intro: Alternanthera dominii, commonly known as the red-leaf alternanthera, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, bright red leaves that contrast with its slender, upright stems. The plant belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in aquatic and terrestrial gardens. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. Alternanthera dominii thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
